description.narrative: Projektet ”Fostering Employment and Growth Opportunities”, FEGO, syftar till att stödja den utveckling som äger rum inom den privata sektorn i fråga om ökad sysselsättning och skapande av egenföretagande bland ungdomar, kvinnor och minoritetsgrupper. Projektet fokuserar på att ge katalytiskt stöd till utvecklingen av mikro- och småföretag inom kläd- och möbelsektorerna, företagsinitiativ för företagande samt utveckling av landsbygdsturism i Kosovo. Den föreslagna insatsen ska genomföras av Swisscontact Foundation. Insatsen bygger på metoden för marknadssystemutveckling (MSD) som inkluderar ett systemiskt, adaptivt och innovativt förhållningssätt. Centralt är lokalt ägda lösningar från olika aktörer i de utvalda sektorerna och områdena

The Fostering Employment and Growth Opportunities (FEGO) project aims at supporting private sector development-led employment and self-employment creation, amongst youth, women and minority communities. The project will catalyze these employment opportunities through two main outcomes, namely the growth and development of micro and small enterprises in the apparel and furniture sectors and business-to-business entrepreneurship initiatives as well as development of rural tourism in Kosovo. The proposed intervention will be implemented by Swisscontact foundation. The intervention is based on market system development (MSD) approach that include a systemic and adaptive approach, innovative, with locally owned solutions by engaging different actors in the selected sectors.

The overall objective of the proposed intervention is job creation and income generation in the furniture, apparel, and rural tourism sectors, to contribute to addressing high unemployment and poverty rates in the country, especially amongst youth and women.
Its specific objective is to facilitate growth and performance improvement in the micro and small and start-up businesses in the apparel, furniture, and rural tourism sectors, and contribute to the emergence of more extensive opportunities for income generation and employment amongst presently poor and socio-economically excluded women, men and youth.
The project facilitates interventions for generating income and employment opportunities for presently poor and marginalized women, men, and youth in Kosovo in the apparel, furniture, and rural tourism sectors. It enables them to seize the growth opportunities in the market systems in the apparel, furniture, and rural tourism sectors, and to overcome the present critical constraints to their effective and favourable integration into these value chains.

tag.narrative: 8.2 - Achieve higher levels of economic productivity through diversification, technological upgrading and innovation, including through a focus on high-value added and labour-intensive sectors.
8.2 - Uppnå högre ekonomisk produktivitet genom diversifiering, teknisk uppgradering och innovation, bland annat genom att fokusera på sektorer med högt förädlingsvärde och hög arbetsintensitet.
